scripts.say: But... it's just the two of us now... you saw what she did to Exeter... and two of your turrets don't function... are we really going after her?
Of course we are. Please remember that our allies are right behind us.
Even if we're not able to sink her, if we can severely damage and corner her then our blockade will prevent her from returning to drydock for repairs.
If we can achieve that, we win. And if we can bring her down on our own, we won't even need to ask the others for help.
So... this was your plan all along, wasn't it? You even let Z1 go because you counted on our blockade up ahead to stop both her and Graf Spee, right?
It wasn't. If a blockade was all that was needed to contain Graf Spee... then we need not have gotten involved in the first place.
Besides, now we're rid of that oversized paperweight that was slowing us down. And if she's in so much pain, she won't be able to leave the docks for some time.
After all, our objective is to take down Graf Spee. No more.
So that's why you had Exeter leave... But won't she totally hate you if you tell her that? She nearly sunk today.
I don't care. People like her are just fun to mess around with.
Right-o, then since you're my friend, I'll just go along with it!

You know, if I had to sacrifice someone either way, I could've given a good reason for you to retreat as well. Anyway, judging from Graf Spee's escape route, we might be able to easily beat her on our own.
That depends on if we can trick her into doing what we want, of course.
And lastly... A-Achilles, thank you for... b-being you!
Ajax? ...Aw, look at you, being all timid~ You never change, silly girl.
